author: COMSOL
description:
This model demonstrates that the bidirectional formulation of the Electromagnetic Waves, Beam Envelopes interface can be used for simulating a beam being reflected in two main directions as it propagates along a waveguide.

An almost collimated Gaussian beam is excited at the left boundary and exhibits total internal reflection (TIR) at the interface between the waveguide and the surrounding air. The beam exits the waveguide after propagating along the waveguide for 20 mm.

This type of light guides is useful for virtual reality (VR) simulation.
label: total_internal_reflection.mph
name: root
